text: Pall Mall is a street in the City of Westminster, London. It is parallel to The Mall. Pall Mall East leads into Trafalgar Square. The street's name is taken from a game called 'pall mall'. The game was a mallet-and-ball game played in the early 17th century. Pall Mall is probably best known for its many Gentlemen's clubs. == Related pages == *Westminster *London == Other websites == *Introductory page from the Survey of London *Pall Mall on TourUK *Panoramic photograph of Pall Mall *19th Century Gentleman's Clubs on Pall Mall (including photographs) *The Institute of Directors' 116 Pall Mall Category:Roads in London
title: Pall Mall
